sen.j: 白鳥峠（しらとりとうげ）とは京都府舞鶴市にある峠。
sen.e: It is a pass located in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shiratori-toge Pass is a pass located in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shiratori-toge Pass is a pass located in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 京都府北部の中核都市である舞鶴市は古より城下町があり商都として栄えた西舞鶴と、軍港として栄えた東舞鶴にわかれて発展してきた。
sen.e: Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, has two central areas of development: Nishi (west) -Maizuru which has been a traditionally commercial city with a castle town, and Higashi (east) -Maizuru which used to thrive with a naval port
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, has been developed as Nishi Maizuru (western Maizuru) with an ancient castle town flourishing as a commercial city and Higashi Maizuru (eastern Maizuru) prospering as a naval port, separately.

Maizuru, a major city in northern Kyoto Prefecture, has been developed as Nishi Maizuru (western Maizuru) with an ancient castle town flourishing as a commercial city and Higashi Maizuru (eastern Maizuru) prospering as a naval port, separately.

sen.j: その双鶴を結ぶ主要幹線の1つであるJR舞鶴線と京都府道28号小倉西舞鶴線に白鳥峠がある。
sen.e: Shiratori-toge Pass in on JR Maizuru Line and Kyoto Prefectural Road 28 Kokura Nishi Maizuru Route which are both arteries connecting these two Maizuru areas.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shiratori-toge Pass is located in the JR Maizuru Line and Kyoto Prefectural Road 28 Kokura Nishi Maizuru Route, arterious connecting both two areas.
Shiratori-toge Pass is located in the JR Maizuru Line and Kyoto Prefectural Road 28 Kokura Nishi Maizuru Route, arterious connecting both two areas.

sen.j: 現在でこそ鉄道や道路が整備されているが、昔は狸が出るような細道で、徒歩で峠をこえていたという。
sen.e: In ancient times, people had to cross the pass on foot and racoon dogs were found around there.
sen.cmt: 「現在で〜整備されているが」を除きました。
sen.e: In the past, people had to cross the pass on foot and raccoon dogs were found around there.
In the past, people had to cross the pass on foot and raccoon dogs were found around there.
